results.title: Hong Kong ; Singapore
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Richard Carey, David Vasser, Film Australia and INCA
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini Dragons”.
The future of Hong Kong rests on what will happen in 1997 when it is returned to the rule of China. The program begins with an optimistic outlook, but after the Tienanmen Square massacre the pessimists begin to hold sway. Singapore enjoys a per capita income second only to Japan in Asia and gives an impression of racial harmony and excellent living conditions. However this success has been gained at the expense of many personal freedoms the rest of the world takes for granted, with the national propaganda machine hiding real inequities and threats from neighbouring and poorer Moslem countries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Barnes, Richard Carey, David Vasser, Film Australia and INCA

results.title: Mini Dragons
results.creator_credit: Richard Carey, Film Australia, INCA and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description: A series which look at the new economic powers of the Asian region - Taiwan, South Korea, Hong Kong and Singapore. Through the eyes of disparate individuals from each country the programs look at the historical context of the mini dragons’ current success and the unique problems they face in their bid to retain economic leadership in the area.

results.title: Paris
results.creator_credit: Valerie Archer, International Video Network and Visa Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
A tourist’s guide to the main historical sites, hotels, shopping, nightlife and food of one of the world’s most loved cities - Paris. Includes a segment on the Palace of Versailles.

results.title: Poland: a proud heritage
results.creator_credit: Andrew K Slodkowski, Chris Valentini and Hughes Leisure Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit Poland, the land of lakes, palaces, forests, cathedrals, sandy beaches and heroes and legends of the past. Visit the capital of Warsaw with its newly restored historical buildings. In Castle Square see the Royal Castle and Sigmund’s Column, the symbol of the city. Travel to Cracow’s Wawel Hill, the ancient seat of Polish kings and hear Polish folklore in the Tatras mountains. Experience the serenity of Bialowieza, Europe’s last virgin woodland. Pause in reflection at the Auschwitz Memorial, travel down the Dunajec River and visit the monastery of Jasna Gora, to see the Black Madonna.

results.title: Alaska: the Alaska experience
results.creator_credit: Michael Heumann, Suzie Heumann and Sonoma Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit vast Alaska and its Northern lights, active volcanos, mountains, lakes and rivers. Alaska is the country of the unexpected. People can sometimes be found fishing at midnight and sunset can be at noon. Take a cruise through the inside passage, home of whales, seals and thousands of birds. Visit Ketchika where the people have largely kept to their traditional ways, and Sitka and its Russian architecture. At Juneau, visit the Red Dog Saloon and at Anchorage, Alaska’s largest city, watch a canoe race and ride a hot air balloon. Meet the locals of Alaska, the Eskimos, Indians and Aleuts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Heumann, Suzie Heumann and Sonoma Video

results.title: Finland: fresh and original
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit unspoilt and unhurried Finland at the crossroads between East and West. Learn about the history of Finland and the Swedish influence on this country. Visit the Baltic port of Helsinki, Jyuaskyla and Finland’s second largest city at Tampere with it famous Lutheran cathedral. Step back in time in Turka with its handicraft museum and visit the Sibelius Museum. Travel north to the unspoilt wilderness of Lapland where the Lapps still tend herds of reindeer. Experience a sauna Finnish style.

results.title: Tales from the kangaroo's crypt (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Energee Entertainment, National Museum of Australia, The Riversleigh Society and University of New South Wales
results.brief_description: This interactive CD-ROM takes you on a time-travelling mystery tour of the Australian fossil record from The PreCambrian Era 3500 million years ago, to the future in 2200 AD. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:MacIntosh: System 7, PC: Windows 3.1 or 95, optimised for 4X CD players.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Energee Entertainment, National Museum of Australia, The Riversleigh Society and University of New South Wales
results.description: This interactive CD-ROM takes you on a time-travelling mystery tour of the Australian fossil record from The PreCambrian Era 3500 million years ago, to the future in 2200 AD. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:MacIntosh: System 7, PC: Windows 3.1 or 95, optimised for 4X CD players.

results.title: Bali: A Window on Paradise
results.creator_credit: Michael Heumann, Richard Yerxa and Sonoma Video Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
A comprehensive tour of the beautiful Indonesian island of Bali - its slumbering volcanoes, mountain lakes, lush green rice paddies and intricate temples. Bali, despite its dependence on tourism, still retains its vital four thousand year old culture. The video takes us to Lake Bratan; Ubud, the country’s cultural centre; Mas, famous for its carved wood masks; the port of Singaraja and the beaches of Sanur.

results.title: Tail of a Tiger
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer and James M. Vernon
results.brief_description: Like all young kids, Orville Ryan is desperate to be part of a group. Unfortunately, the one he tries to gain acceptance from, is the local gang of neighbourhood bullies! And “this little dag” just doesn’t belong with them. So he is picked on, chased and battered. But through all this unfairness he happens upon an eccentric old man, who is given a hard time by the same boys. The two of them strike up a relationship based on their similar love for the freedom of flight and a broken down Tiger Moth. Orville persuades the recluse to rebuild the Moth - and Orville’s life takes off with it!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer and James M. Vernon

results.title: Tales from a suitcase: the Afghan experience [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Andrea Dal Bosco, Will Davies, Look Television Productions and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: This acclaimed SBS series takes the viewer through the experiences of Afghan people who came to Australia from the 1970s to the present. Seven diverse stories reflect the range of trials faced by people who have experienced life under numerous regimes, including Communism, Mujaheddin and the Taliban. Episode 1: Artist George Gittoes discuses his visit to Afghanistan, the stories of which inspired new work that speaks of harrowing tales. Episode 2: Professor Hala and Doctor Safi were once teacher and student at the University of Kabul. Their lives of politics, journalism and brutal persecution took them on separate courses until they both found asylum in Australia. Episode 3: In 1979 Abdullah Shariat left fourth year medical school to become a freedom fighter, in Northern Afghanistan, against the Communists. Episode 4: Karima Haroon is an exuberant young woman from Afghanistan who arrived in Australia as a boat refugee. Tragic circumstances have forced her to take responsibility for her entire family. Episode 5: Khadern Nori and Shafiq Monis are both from the Hazara tribe in Afghanistan. Following persecution by the Taliban they spent a treacherous journey aboard a boat travelling to Australia before spending a year in Woomera Detention Centre. Episode 6: Sayd Sarshar, a musician, Dr Nooria Mehraby, a counsellor, and Mohammed Arif, a refugee, discuss their country’s many years of turmoil. Episode 7: Abeda Iqbal and Massooda Hassan are two close girlfriends in their early twenties who arrived in Australia as children. They discuss their hopes for the future. Some quite remarkable and heart-rending tales emerge from these intimate and revelatory interviews.
